eu.clementime.rds
Class World

java.lang.Object
  eu.clementime.rds.World

public class World
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains playing rules (for actions, triggering, database modifiers, saving, settings, walking...) and controls database access.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Clément

isItemTakeable

public boolean isItemTakeable(int itemId)

activateTrigger

public int[] activateTrigger(int triggerId)
Triggers 6 kinds of actions: launch an animation, change database with a modifier, move or hide doll, show a bubble, hide/show an item or hide/show an animation.

Parameters:
dbh - database handler is stored for upcoming database calls
Returns:
integer array with 10 entries:
next trigger - if there is another trigger launched following this one, id of the trigger, 0 if not,
animation on screen - if the trigger is to animate a screenAnim, id of the screeAnim,
doll moving - if the trigger is to animate the doll, x where the doll has to be moved,
doll is hidden - if doll is moving, it can be off screen,
text activated - if an animation text is activated, id of this text,
take item from screen - id of item to add in inventory,
doll moving y velocity,
hide/show screen item,
hide/show animation,
simultaneous trigger - if there is another trigger to launch at the same time, id of the trigger

activateModifier

private int activateModifier(int toTriggerId)
Triggers +/-10 kinds of modifier, that is to say changes in database: combination (switch allowed/not allowed), change item position (switch screen/inventory/nowhere), take, look, talk, takeable (yes/no), exit (visible/not visible), modify starting trigger in screen table.

Parameters:
toTriggerId - modifier to trigger
Returns:
id of item (for change item position only)

save

public void save(int screenId,
                 float x,
                 float y)
When saving, x and y doll position are saved as for larger allowed screen density.

calculateWalkArea

public void calculateWalkArea(float dollFeetPosition)
Calculates a trapezoidal area where player activates walking when touching it.

Parameters:
dollFeetPosition - y at start (why, I have no idea... oh yes, I remember: to calculate y max and min of walking area)

                             int xMax,

Checks if the player touched inside walk area.
